questions.text: Two angles of a triangle are equal and the third angle is 80°. Find each of the equal angles.
questions.explanation:
Let each equal angle = x
x + x + 80° = 180°
2x = 100°
x = 50°

questions.text: In a right-angled triangle, if the two sides are 3 cm and 4 cm, find the hypotenuse.
questions.explanation:
Using Pythagoras theorem:
Hypotenuse² = 3² + 4² = 9 + 16 = 25
Hypotenuse = √25 = 5 cm

This is the famous 3-4-5 Pythagorean triplet.

questions.text: Find the area of a square with side 12 cm.
The perimeter of a rectangle is 60 cm and its length is 18 cm. Find its breadth.
questions.explanation:
Perimeter = 2(l + b)
60 = 2(18 + b)
30 = 18 + b
b = 12 cm

questions.text: Find the area of a triangle with base 10 cm and height 8 cm.
questions.explanation:
Area of triangle = (1/2) × base × height
= (1/2) × 10 × 8
= 40 cm²

questions.text: The diameter of a circle is 14 cm. Find its circumference. (Use π = 22/7)
Find the area of a rhombus whose diagonals are 12 cm and 16 cm.
questions.explanation:
Area of rhombus = (1/2) × d₁ × d₂
= (1/2) × 12 × 16
= 96 cm²

questions.text: Find the area of an equilateral triangle with side 6 cm. (Use √3 = 1.732)
questions.explanation:
Area of equilateral triangle = (√3/4) × side²
= (1.732/4) × 36
= 0.433 × 36
= 15.588 ≈ 15.59 cm²

questions.text: The diagonal of a square is 10√2 cm. Find its side.
questions.explanation:
Diagonal of square = side × √2
10√2 = side × √2
side = 10 cm

questions.text: Find the area of a trapezium with parallel sides 8 cm and 12 cm, and height 5 cm.
questions.explanation:
Area of trapezium = (1/2) × (sum of parallel sides) × height
= (1/2) × (8 + 12) × 5
= (1/2) × 20 × 5
= 50 cm²

questions.text: The total surface area of a cube is 294 cm². Find its edge.
questions.explanation:
Total surface area = 6a²
294 = 6a²
a² = 49
a = 7 cm

questions.text: Find the volume of a cuboid with length 8 cm, breadth 5 cm, and height 4 cm.
questions.explanation:
Volume of cuboid = l × b × h
= 8 × 5 × 4
= 160 cm³

questions.text: Find the curved surface area of a cylinder with radius 7 cm and height 10 cm. (Use π = 22/7)
Find the volume of a cone with radius 3 cm and height 7 cm. (Use π = 22/7)
Find the surface area of a sphere with radius 7 cm. (Use π = 22/7)
The exterior angle of a triangle is 120°. If one interior opposite angle is 50°, find the other interior opposite angle.
questions.explanation:
Exterior angle = Sum of two opposite interior angles
120° = 50° + x
x = 70°

questions.text: Two complementary angles are in the ratio 2:3. Find the larger angle.
questions.explanation:
Let angles be 2x and 3x
Complementary means sum = 90°
2x + 3x = 90°
5x = 90°
x = 18°

Larger angle = 3x = 54°

questions.text: Find the area of a parallelogram with base 15 cm and height 8 cm.
questions.explanation:
Area of parallelogram = base × height
= 15 × 8
= 120 cm²
